intro: Glochidion fortunei var. megacarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is distinctive, being large and fleshy, which aids in seed dispersal. This variant is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, tropical environments.
